name: Alan Jasanoff, PhD (PI)
bio: Alan is interested in mechanistic studies of neural function using brain-wide measurements and on tool development for molecular neuroimaging.

name: Andrew Becker
bio: Andrew focuses on experimental procedures that permit combined behavior and imaging studies in rodents.

name: Brenna Stallings
bio: Brenna specializes in handling and training rodents and nonhuman primate subjects for next-generation fMRI experiments.

name: Gracia Garcia, PhD
bio: Gracia is interested in nanochemistry and nanoparticle-based probes for noninvasive molecular neuroimaging.

name: Gregory Thiabaud, PhD
bio: Greg works on design and synthesis of novel MRI sensors based on a variety of paramagnetic chelator complexes.

name: He Wei, PhD
bio: He is a nanotechnology expert interested in applying nanoparticle-based imaging agents to measure molecular targets in the brain.

name: Hippolyte Bournisien de Valmont
bio: Hippolyte is interested in brain-wide analyses of neural mechanisms that underlie mammalian cognitive function.

name: Itay Fayer
bio: Itay is interested in studying brain-periphery interactions using a range of MRI-based readouts in animals.

name: Jacob Simon, PhD
bio: Jacob works on a novel imaging agent architecture for ultrasensitive detection of neural signaling molecules.

name: Kevin Chung
bio: Kevin is interested in applying functional and molecular imaging for high resolution mapping of brain activity during behavior.

name: Kyle Backman
bio: Kyle works on animal models of substance use disorders and on applications of functional and molecular imaging in addiction biology.

name: Miranda Dawson
bio: Miranda is a bioengineer working on novel strategies for genetic imaging and mapping plasticity related processes in the brain.

name: Miriam Schwalm, PhD
bio: Miriam focuses on application of novel imaging and recording techniques to study the brain-wide dynamics of neural activity.

name: Robert Ohlendorf, PhD
bio: Robert works on developing probes that harness physiological processes to produce novel readouts in functional and molecular imaging.

name: Sajal Sen, PhD
bio: Sajal is a synthetic chemist who works on small molecule contrast agents for mechanistic MRI-based studies of brain function in health and disease.

name: Sarah Bricault, PhD
bio: Sarah studies drivers of resting-state brain activity, as well as neural dynamics involved in motivated behavior.

name: Sayani Das, PhD
bio: Sayani is an expert in chemical probe design who works on contrast agents for ultrasensitive molecular neuroimaging.

name: Valerie Phi Van, MD
bio: Valerie is a radiologist and preclinical MRI expert who is interested in using genetic probes to study molecular processes in animal models.

name: Ying Jiang, PhD
bio: Ying works on development and application of neural circuit-specific imaging tools for understanding brain function at a systems level.

name: Yuting Ke, PhD
bio: Yuting works on genetically encoded fMRI probes and applying them to cellular and circuit-level neuroimaging in animals.
